page.title: 15The River Leven.
page.content: The River Leven is a main attraction of the village of{Great Ayton.}The wildlife on the river is mainly flies and fish such as{Bullheads, Minnows, {Catfish and Trout.}The river has contrasting banks. One side is residential and the other grazing land.As you walk along the banks of the river ,you can hear the Suggits waterfall roaring. It was built in 1840 to stop floods. The water in the Leven is quite clean.It is six feet deep at its deepest point. On one side of the river you can see{Mr. Suggitt's house it is called Greenbank .Mr. Suggitt's ice cream shop is opposite. The source of the river can be found {8Km South East}of Great Ayton. It runs from{Easby}through the village to the Tees which it enters just below Yarm.
